task.title: Configure SELinux
task.shortdesc: Security-enabled Linux (SELinux) is a security feature for Linux that allows you to set access control through policies. Beginning with 4.3.0, the install packages automatically install the SELinux policy on RHEL 7 / CentOS 7.

prereq.p: You should have installed and configured on RHEL 7 / CentOS 7.
